wiki.summary: “Hide & Seek” works as a promotional single from Stormzy’s third studio album This Is What I Mean. Opting for a softer tone, the track features vocals from Nigerian singers Oxlade, Äyanna, and Teni. In writing this song, Stormzy also involved Nigerian singer-songwriter Tems. Stormzy’s lead singles have traditionally been boastful, hard-hitting call-outs, such as the iconic “Big For Your Boots” and “Vossi Bop”, while this track breaks from that tradition. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: “Hide & Seek” works as a promotional single from Stormzy’s third studio album This Is What I Mean. Opting for a softer tone, the track features vocals from Nigerian singers Oxlade, Äyanna, and Teni. In writing this song, Stormzy also involved Nigerian singer-songwriter Tems. Stormzy’s lead singles have traditionally been boastful, hard-hitting call-outs, such as the iconic “Big For Your Boots” and “Vossi Bop”, while this track breaks from that tradition. The music video features well-known British actress Saffron Hocking and shows the eventual breakdown of a relationship between two characters, as Stormzy reminisces in an empty apartment that they once shared. "That song is called “Hide and Seek”. I’m really proud of it. I think it’s a song I’ve been trying to have the confidence to write my whole career. A song where I can rap and sing, and create something really warm. I love warmth, I love soul and melody. I would hear other people make songs like that and I’d be a bit jealous, because it felt like it was their bag. So to be able to do them myself, it’s a bit like coming full circle." — Stormzy via i-D Read more on Last.fm.
